report_title: Online Residential Home Sale Listings in the US
executive_summary: Online residential home listing companies manage a virtual marketplace, providing services connecting residential home sellers to buyers. Through 2023, online listing services have performed exceedingly well, as residential home sales have increased due to solid homeownership rates due to favorable mortgage rates in the early part of the period and a scorching hot housing market in the latter part.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry performance will be closely tied to residential real estate market movements and trends. As the house price index increases and house demand falls, online listings' revenue follows. For example, amid strong demand for residential real estate during COVID-19, property owners listed their homes for sale via industry platforms to capitalize on rising home prices, propelling industry revenue upward.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: NETWORK EFFECTS SPUR CONSOLIDATION AND LOW BARRIERS SPARK ENTRY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Significant industry players like Zillow Group Inc. (Zillow) have actively made strategic acquisitions to bolster product offerings and expand geographic reach. Zillow owns some of the most recognizable home and apartment listing brands (Trulia, StreetEasy), and these acquisitions produce network effects.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition's Bite May Originate From Unexpected Sources
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While platforms target tech-savvy home buyers for future growth, other platforms could make inroads.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Expanding Features Keep Buyers Online and Sellers Selling
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: During the height of COVID-19, mobile applications and desktop websites offered digital tours and online floorplans, keeping people safe.
The house price index is expected to continue to climb, indicating a slower housing market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Entry Can Lead to Further Concentration
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The low cost of entry spurs many to enter with new online services or as a niche provider.

industry_definition: This industry provides internet listings and search functions for residential properties that are for sale.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level - low - increasing

key_trends: Competition takes on a Davis versus Goliath dynamic.
Prices remain competitive due to potential competition.
COVID-19 solidifies the value of online services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment accounts for 38.0% of the market.
Adults aged 40 to 49 account for 22.0% of users.
Older adults represent the largest segment at 40.0%.

products_and_services.product_description: The single-family housing market is estimated to account for a combined 76.5% of listings.
Video capability becomes critical for online multifamily listings.

tier_2_buyers: Real Estate Sales & Brokerage in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The house price index measures the value of homes and residential real estate in the United States.

business_locations.location_description: The distribution of locations approximates the distribution of the US population.
The Great Lakes and Southeast have fewer locations relative to their populations share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages and purchase costs drive revenue volatility
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: To compete in the online marketplace, costs are incurred to adopt state-of-the-art technology.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Economic factors and shocks kick revenue down and upwards
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Housing demand performance during the COVID-19 was uncharacteristically changeable.
